AAE220.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
AAE220.description: Systematic review of English grammar. Intensive and extensive writing of English.

AAE221.name: English Composition for Non-Native Speakers of English
AAE221.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
AAE221.description: Intensive and extensive writing in English for academic purposes.

AAE222.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
AAE222.description: Improvement of oral English skills for academic purposes.

AAE223.name: Reading for Academic Purposes for Non-Native Speakers of English
AAE223.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
AAE223.description: Study of English for students needing a reading knowledge of English for academic purposes
AAE223.prerequisite: Designated score on English Language Center test

AAE451.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
AAE451.description: Preparation for non-native speakers of English. Focuses on English pronunciation and fluency, strategies for common TA situations, and language and culture of the American classroom.

AAE452.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
AAE452.description: Preparation for non-native speakers of English. Covers pronunciation, discourse of teaching, and student/instructor interactions.

AAE453.name: Support for In-service International Teaching Assistants
AAE453.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
AAE453.description: In-service support for non-native speakers of English. Covers language of classroom management, discourse of teaching, and student/instructor interactions. Additional language and pedagogical support concurrent with their TA assignment.
